column4: Anyone know why xorg sucks up 25-100% of my cpu? Seems to be a common problem, yet the many suggested solutions doesn't seem to work for me.

I've also looked through the ubuntu wiki on X troubleshooting, HighCPU in particular.. I find it hard to believe that it's a client application. It's not software rasterizing. I've tried various drivers. Logs seem fine.
what video chip do you use?
I got an Nvidia 8800GT card
have you installed the nvidia proprietary driver?
I've tried a few different ones.. I think the proprietary drivers were the original ones? I'll check
right now I got in my xorg.conf under Section "Device", Driver "nvidia".. so that's the proprietary ones, yes? Package installed, nvidia-173 I believe
can you pastebin your xorg.conf please
http://pastebin.com/73gBvRGr .. what if I install nvidia-current instead maybe? Anything I should think of to make sure it gets used rather than the old nvidia-173?
that's all I know then, maybe others can help
you may want to add the resolution you use in the screen section in the display subsection
I'll do that. You think it might speed things up..?
does nvidia-settings    show an error when you run it?
no
ok then run:  gksudo nvidia-settings      setup the display (even set the refresh rate) and then click "Save to X config file"   may help
xorg is still gobbling up all my cpu :/
are there any bugs reported?
to the developers? Yes, plenty. Since many years back. They don't seem to give a fuck.
could try the 185 driver to test
I don't find the 185 drivers in kpackagekit
could try removing 173 and install nvidia-current
did that
Yeah.. Thanks, you've been most helpful. Considering just switching back to arch instead..
I use a 6150 and use nouveau + kwin   works really well
